bug.short_desc: compare editor shows changes on wrong side

long_desc.thetext: When opening a compare editor from a patch set, the changes appear on the left. They should be on the right like when you apply a patch.

It is correct that the new content is shown on the left and the base revision on the right side. This is consistent with the behavior of the Synchronize view. It differs from the Gerrit web front-end and patch wizard but I believe is most consistent with Eclipse given that changes are shown in the compare editor.
It is only consistent with the behaviour of the synchronize view for Git, which is backwards from everything else (CVS, SVN). See for example comment 2 of bug 350623.

That's a good point. I assumed that this was general Eclipse behavior but CVS clearly shows remote (newer) changes on the right side when opening incoming changes from the Synchronize view. I'll see if it's reasonable to revert the inputs, otherwise we'll have to do this for 1.1.
Incoming changes on the right is also consistent with the direction of the arrows used by the Synchronize view. :-)
I was wondering why the Git behavior always seems confusing to me! :)
Also note that when you select a deletion in the Gerrit compare editor, the status bar says "incoming addition" because the sides are backwards.
